meanings.definition: To mix liquids together to form an emulsion.
meanings.sent1: She emulsified the oil and vinegar to make a salad dressing.
meanings.sent2: The chef emulsified the ingredients to create a smooth sauce.
meanings.sent3: The blender emulsified the ingredients so well that they danced together in harmony.
meanings.sent4: Her words emulsified the tension in the room, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The artist emulsified colors on the canvas, blending them into a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The ingredients emulsified perfectly, creating a creamy texture.
meanings.sent2: When shaken, the vinaigrette emulsified into a thick dressing.
meanings.sent3: The potion emulsified in the cauldron, bubbling and transforming into a magical elixir.
meanings.sent4: As the music played, the crowd emulsified into a unified dance, moving as one.
meanings.sent5: The clouds emulsified in the sky, blending into a breathtaking sunset.

meanings.sent1: The emulsified sauce coated the pasta, giving it a rich flavor.
meanings.sent2: The emulsified mixture settled into a smooth and creamy consistency.
meanings.sent3: The emulsified paint on the canvas shimmered under the gallery lights.
meanings.sent4: The emulsified lotion left her skin feeling soft and moisturized.
meanings.sent5: The emulsified colors in the photograph created a vibrant and captivating image.
